What is this?
What is Pay on Delivery?
Pay on Delivery (POD) includes Cash on Delivery (COD) as well as Debit card / Credit card / Net banking payments at your doorstep.
EMI starts at 1,806 per month. EMI starts at 1,806. No Cost EMI available if you checkout only with this item. Options
EMI (Easy Installments)
  • Pay for your order in equal monthly installments (EMI), using any one of the cards in the table below.
  • Your bank will convert the payment into EMI in 3-4 working days.
  • To make this a No Cost EMI offer, the interest amount will be discounted from the price of your order. Your card will be charged for the item price minus the discounted interest. The total amount you will pay to the bank (excluding GST) will be equal to the price of the item. The bank will charge GST on the interest amount.

Paras Jain
4.0 out of 5 starsHigh on performance, low on build.
17 May 2018
Verified Purchase
Its been almost more than a week since I bought this laptop from Amazon for 37k. I use it for Mobile Application and Web Development, light weight gaming, youtubing etc.
Pros :-
1. FHD Resolution
2. Latest Intel i5 8th Generation processor. Overclocks to more than 3.0GHz (don't be disappointed by the base clock of 1.6GHz). It has 4 physical cores and multithreaded applications will run flawlessly. The processor is about 40% faster than the previous generation of i5 processors.
3. 8GB RAM is just enough, looking at the price point it couldn't have been more than this. I'm considering an upgrade here.
4. Chicklet design keyboard. It is at least better than the keyboard provided on earlier HP budget laptops. PS It's not as good as the Lenovo Ideapad has to offer.
5.The inner ergonomics of the laptop feel good, especially the wood looking design.
6. More than 5 hrs of battery backup with fast charging (charges completely in less than 2 hours). You can't expect anything more than that from a budget HP laptop.
7. Light weight.
8. Fast boot time unlike many other laptops which have a slight BIOS delay.

Cons:-
1. Pathetic outer build quality. Even though I handle my laptop single handedly with extreme care, top of the laptop has got lots of deep scratches, have ordered a laptop skin.
2. Speakers although are good, but placed weirdly at the bottom. Still you will get average sound quality.
3. No VGA port.
4. For developers like myself, 5400 RPM hard drive is a serious bottleneck. Still given the low cost, you can spend a few bucks for a 128 GB SSD and a drive caddy for SSD upgrade.
5. Display quality is not good enough. Color reproduction and contrast is not upto the mark. I feel that way may be cause I'm coming from using a Macbook Pro which has an IPS panel.

Miscellaneous :-
For Android Studio users : IDE runs pretty well as long as you don't use the emulator. HDD usage goes to 100% frequently and you'll experience lags until the gradle build etc. finishes. Otherwise the IDE experience is good. 4GB RAM upgrade and 128 GB SSD will together cost around 7k, and I'm pretty much sure that this laptop will perform like a beast after that. You won't get any other laptop in 44k range with SSD and 12 Gigs of RAM along with an 8th generation i5.

Ramkrishna Mokashi
4.0 out of 5 starsThe Laptop has good build, good quality and value for the price
19 April 2018
Verified Purchase
The Laptop has good build, good quality and value for the price.

I was comparing this model with two other model from HP.

1) with separate Graphics Card + Win 10 + Office 2016 installed = cost around 54000/-
2) with separate Graphics Card (but no Win 10 + and no Office 16) = cost around 46000/-
3) this model - same spec as above two but no Graphics Card (I dont need it, since i dont play games. Also, Intel UHD 620 does a pretty good job). No Win 10+Office 2016 (I dont need either because i am a linux user.)

After installation of Debian, everything went smooth. Works perfectly fine.

One Problem that i came across was WIFI does not work in Linux since this realtek rtl8723de is still not officially supported by any of the Linux Distro. There is an unofficial version on Github which you will have to use.

Other than WIFI problem, rest seems ok. Battery is good. Screen display is adequate.

Kiran Nair
TOP 100 REVIEWER
5.0 out of 5 starsi5 8th Gen laptop at budget range
14 January 2018
Verified Purchase
HP 15-bs145tu 15.6-inch FHD Laptop (8th Gen Intel Core i5-8250U/8GB/1TB/Free DOS/Integrated Graphics), Sparkling Black
I was looking to buy a Windows laptop since few months and decided to buy one with the 8th Gen i5. Was looking for some options from US, where the price was way cheaper than India. Later decided to get it from India after I found this option for 38990. I got the laptop on Brand new sealed packaged by HP, imported a month before my purchase. Package had laptop along with power adapter and manual guides. HP pre-installed the DOS. Had to delete all the DOS partitions and HP document partition before Windows 10 installation, as it was of MBR type partition unlike the GPT type needed for Windows 10. After Windows 10 installation you can install "HP support assistant" which will download all the necessary drivers needed and install them upon your acceptance. After installing all the compatible device drivers the performance has improved.

Review
*******
- LOOKS - Its all black, especially the sparkling black looks awesome and upmarket. The inner side is matte finish with waves type design

- KEYBOARD - Smooth chiclet keys without Backlit. Quality of the keys don't seems to be upscale. But considering the price range it seems to be good.

- TRACKPAD - Awesome synaptics trackpad with multi-touch gestures. Could have been a little big though

- KEYS - Total 12 function keys including Brightness, multimedia, airplane mode.

- BATTERY - Battery life seems to be good considering the 8th Gen processor is slightly under-clocked. But I am yet to test the capability. Even the battery charging is fast as promised by HP.

- Processor - Intel i5-8250U is the first in the line up for laptop processors in case of 8th Gen i5. It is having a base clock of 1.6GHz and a turboboost capable of 3.4GHZ. It has 4 cores and 8 threads compared to i5 7th gen which has only 2 cores and 4 threads. Although it is underclocked compared to 7th gen, it adds up the battery life and compensates that with 2 additional cores than 7th Gen.

- RAM - It is equipped with Hynix DDR4 2400 RAM which is the best you can get nowadays in .

- HDD - 1TB 5400 rpm HDD from Toshiba, good for regular use, and is giving decent boot times.

- OPTICAL DRIVE - It comes with a DVD RW drive. But nowadays hardly anyone uses it.

- SCREEN - Laptop has a full HD (1920 x 1080) anti glare display. It is normal TN panel and not IPS, which is common in this price range. So you have to compromise on the viewing angles, but the display is sharp and good for daily use.

- GRAPHICS - Sorry, as it does not have discrete graphics card it may not be suitable for gaming, but the Intel UHD 620 can handle 4K displays, and few games as well. I was very particular that if I buy a i3, then I will buy one with discrete graphics card. With i5 I can compromise this point, as the processor is able to manage the daily needs without a graphics card but should have at least 8GB RAM.

- PROTECTION - It doesn't get hot or overheat, you can keep it without required cooling stand. Fan is pretty noisy when you are pushing the limits of the laptop.

- ADAPTER - It has a standard 65W AC adapter with small pin which is coming in HP laptop nowadays

- COMPONENTS - It has two USB 3.0 ports, one USB 2.0 port, one HDMI 1.4 port, one RJ45, on headphone / mic 3.5mm jack, SD card reader

- WEIGHT - It is so lightweight, and only 2kg. The laptop is handy for a 15.6 inch type.

- SPEAKERS It is crispy, clear and not so loud.

- CAMERA It has a 720p FaceTime HD camera, I do not use such feature so I cannot say much about the in-depth details.

- BLUETOOTH It connects my Dell Travel mouse without installing any driver. I also tried Bluetooth headphone, and it connects as well.

- SUPPORT It comes with one-year warranty

- BUY ONLINE I had lot of doubt in buying it online due to the duplicate/counterfeit parts, but this is not true. The product was genuine and came with proper warranty. I have already checked it at HP website and registered it.

Cons
*****

- NO USB Type C port
- Viewing angles of display

Have any questions regarding the laptop, contact me.
